title: NASA discutirá su labor en materia climática tras temperaturas record
summary: La dirección de la NASA, incluidos expertos en clima entre los que figura un hispanohablante, estará disponible a las 4 p.m. EDT del jueves 20 de julio en la sede de la agencia en Washington para hacer balance de los recientes fenómenos meteorológicos extremos y discutir cómo la investigación y los datos de la NASA están posibilitando soluciones cl

title: Rocket Lab launches 7 satellites, recovers first stage booster
summary: The ‘Baby Come Back’ mission successfully lifted off from Launch Complex 1B on the Mahia Peninsula in New Zealand at 01:27 UTC,...

title: Starlink brings Wifi to Kenya
summary: Starlink brings Wifi to Kenya amidst ISP dominance battle with Africa-based Satellite ISPs

title: NASA Maintains ‘A’ for Investing in Small Businesses
summary: During an Investing in America event Tuesday with NASA leadership, the Small Business Administration (SBA) announced the space agency earned an “A” for the sixth consecutive year for its work with small businesses, exceeding its goals by 18%.

title: Electron launches seven smallsats in latest step towards reusability
summary: A Rocket Lab Electron rocket placed seven smallsats for three customers into orbit July 17 on a launch that also brought the company a step closer to reusing the rocket’s booster.

title: Young space firms are driving acquisition activity
summary: Young space companies made more acquisitions than their older peers over the last 12 months, according to analysis from British investment firm Seraphim Space.

title: UK Parliament Recommends Simplifying Launch Licensing Process
summary: The UK Parliament's Science and Technology Committee has recommended the simplifying of the launch licensing process for space companies operating within the country. The committee's proposal aims to facilitate the growth of the U.K.'s commercial space sector by reducing bureaucratic hurdles and ensuring a more efficient licensing procedure.

title: Virgin Galactic Announces Galactic 02 Crew
summary: Virgin Galactic is preparing to launch its send commercial mission, Galactic-02, and now we know who will be on board!

title: Launch Roundup: Rocket Lab conducts Electron reuse attempt, SpaceX to fly two Starlink v2 missions
summary: The week of July 16 through July 23 will see at least four more launches take place around the world, potentially increasing the orbital launch count to 108 so far in 2023. This includes Rocket Lab’s launch of the “Baby Come Back” mission (which featured a first stage recovery attempt), two more SpaceX Starlink v2 missions, and the launch of a Chinese Kuaizhou 1A rocket with an as-yet-unknown payload.

title: NASA to Discuss Climate Work in Wake of Record High Temps
summary: NASA leadership, including climate experts, will be available at 4 p.m. EDT on Thursday, July 20, at the agency’s headquarters in Washington to shed light on recent extreme weather events, and discuss how NASA research and data is enabling climate solutions.
